New Records: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82 runs, the highest score in the match.
Arshdeep Singh took 3 wickets for 32 runs in his four overs.
India recorded their first win in a high-pressure T20I match against Pakistan.
Hardik Pandya and Virat Kohli formed a 113-run partnership for the fifth wicket, which was crucial for India's victory.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit two sixes off Mohammad Nawaz to reduce the target to 16 runs off the final over.
Pakistan's middle-order collapse after a strong start by Iftikhar Ahmed and Shan Masood.
Mohammad Ashwin hit the winning run off Shaheen Afridi to secure the match for India in the last ball.
The match was played in front of a capacity crowd of 90,293 fans at the MCG.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was highly anticipated as a key game in the Super 12 stage of the T20 World Cup.
Pakistan struggled early on, losing key players Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.
Iftikhar Ahmed and Shan Masood helped Pakistan recover to a competitive total.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his disbelief at the victory, calling it a special moment.
The match was a pivotal moment in the tournament for India and Pakistan.
The win sparked jubilant scenes among the fans and on the pitch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the MCG, which has hosted several high-profile cricket matches.
The crowd's support was a significant factor in the match's atmosphere.
This was a significant win for India, considering their previous struggles in high-pressure T20I matches.
